title: I got a permanent ban on my account over a year ago
body:
Hello fellow summoners,

I got a permanent ban on my account over a year ago, furthermore I took those charges to myself personally after having many talks between myself and league of legends support every now and then. So i created a new account on euw to prove to the league community that i am no longer performing any negative behavior towards others, and achieving a level 5 honor on the new account. Therefore I just wanted to ask if there was any chance of me getting my account back on eune because I had a lot of purchases done there and would not like my account to go to dust.

I am open to negotiate with anyone, 

If you could please let me know what I can do regarding this case.

Although if you see me commenting in an aggressive way please do not take me as that kind of person it is just the way i talk which is too serious.

and thank you in advance. GGWP!!

Hope you continue to have an amazing day/weekend

Your faithfulness

Jason

first discussion i post but thank you.

#Permanent is permanent.

Edit to reflect points posed in replies: 
#Permanent is still permanent.

Ive watched a couple of videos on youtube, and many after being toxic managed to get their accounts back.

Put it this way here is one of the links real quick. 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7PmK_muMlR4

No one, who was **correctly permabanned** (note: that is 99.99% of cases), has ever gotten their account unbanned.

The guy in the video got unbanned because Riot saw it as an incorrect ban because he didn't deserve it. If you already contacted support and they told you no, it's because Riot correctly banned you. As in you deserved it. 

If you didn't contact support, you are of course free to do so. But don't get your hopes up because as I said: 99.99% of permabans are correctly applied.

Well then thats pretty much all i can do but its kind of unfair as the permanent ban is really strict. should be in this order

* 5 chat bans
* 10 chat bans
* 25 chat bans
* 2 week chat ban (14 days)
* 1 month ban
* 2 month ban and etc.

if the guys dont learn from the 1 month ban, then they will just keep waiting each month gets longer and longer which should be the way to do it.

That's the... problem. Every ban in between there is another 1-3 or even more games ruined for other players.

I could say the same thing about the current system - players who don't learn from their 14 day ban and chat restrictions will just keep waiting *then come back and ruin more games* - unless they are shown the door with a permanent ban.

I understand where you are coming from, but yet again "**_Players who dont learn from their 14 day ban and chat restrictions will keep waiting then come back and ruin more games_**" I understand what you mean, but dont you think what i said above instead of the perma ban, start it from there 
> * 1 month ban
> * 2 month ban and etc.
and if they keep doing it, then it will be the summoner wasting his time, for me i dont mind anything, but i am just being realistic for myself and others.
Its a much fair deal than the perma ban, because perma is perma meanwhile those suspensions are lessons for the summoners if it keeps occurring let it be they get to wait an addition of 2 months.

Just being realistic at the moment

Because after that 1 month ban, they'll come back and ruin at least one, and likely more games before getting 2 month ban.

And after the 2 month ban, they'll come back and ruin at least one, and likely more games before getting a X month ban.

Etc. etc. until they're permanently banned.

Riot has tried more punishments in the past. There was virtually no reform in between a 14 day ban and the permanent ban - regardless of how many steps it took to get there. Players who come back after a 14 day ban and do not reform, statistically have a very low (well less than 5%) chance of reforming. And it's not worth all the lost, ruined, and abusive games that would happen just for the rare one or two players who may reform.

Yea i understand, but as i stated below nobody is an angel, we all have bad games, and nobody can control their temper no matter how hard you hold it. It eventually comes out not knowing how it happened or escalated to that level, plus 1 and 2 months and x months on wards are a lot of time i do not insist a 14 day suspension is enough time to teach the person his lesson, because close an eye open an eye thats 14 days gone. Time starts to fly now, but not in months when you dont have a back up account or anything to do, which is enough room to learn your mistake, Although not everyone is always winning games, eventually you will lose no matter how many winning streaks you had, which is why the month suspensions will be a good time to reform someone.

To be completely honest with you, I know multiple people who've been playing since before season 1 and have never even gotten a chat restriction.

It is **not** in human nature to make others feel like shit. It is in human nature to get frustrated, but it is lack of self control that causes people to flame.

You're making claims but you provide no evidence for them - as I've said, Riot has tried longer punishments before, and they did not work. You can't just say that they will suddenly work where they didn't before.

Alright good talk enjoy ur evening i suppose.

but to conclude it is a negative 100% i will get my account back right? ;)
